title: Ticket #754: Option for jobs that run multiple times to append to output and error
description:
Currently when a Condor job runs for the second or later times, it completely replaces the output and error files. While this is usually the correct behavior, it may not be what is desired in all cases. For example, the VDT is using Condor's cron behavior and would like the output and error to be appended to reflect an ongoing log file.

Proposal: Add new options for condor_submit: "AppendError" and "AppendOutput". Both default to FALSE. If TRUE, these files will be appended to, not replaced, when a job runs a second or later time.

This may lead to excessively large files for cron jobs that run over a long period or very frequently. In such a case automatic rotation and deletion might be nice; see #755.

#326 suggests general shell-like control that might be used to implement this.
